thread.title: Lotto winner Jane Park sells house and flogs furniture on Facebook as she moves back in with her mum
thread.title_full: Lotto winner Jane Park sells house and flogs furniture on Facebook as she moves back in with her mum

author: mirror
title: Lotto winner Jane Park sells house and flogs furniture on Facebook as she moves back in with her mum
text:
News Lotto winner Jane Park sells house and flogs furniture on Facebook as she moves back in with her mum Property records show Jane - who won the jackpot when she was just 17 - has sold her three-bedroom property as she 'felt lonely' Share Jane Park offered items of furniture on Facebook before leaving the three-bedroom house (Photo: Sunday Mirror) Share Get daily   
Lottery millionaire Jane Park has sold the house she won after scooping the jackpot as a teenager to move back in with her mum. 
Jane, 21, also flogged her furniture on Facebook following sale of the three-bedroom property in Prestonpans, East Lothian, the Daily Record reports. 
She was just 17 when she claimed £1million with her first ever lotto ticket. 
Property records reveal the semi-detached house in Corporal John Shaw Court was sold in December for £185,000. Before moving home with her mum (Photo: XPOSUREPHOTOS.COM) 
Records show it was bought for £169,995 in November 2013. 
Jane – who is currently facing a drink-driving charge – was offering items of furniture on Facebook in the run-up to the house sale. 
On December 13 – three days before the house sale was apparently finalised – she posted photos of a red sofa and white table, chairs and TV unit with the message: “Anyone interested? Message me.” Jane Park became a lottery winner after buying a ticket for the first time (Photo: Sunday Mirror) Jane Park won the cash in August 2013 (Photo: PA) She is due to face a drink-drive trial this week 
Contacted by potential buyers, she replied: “Everyone’s mailed me 150 for table n chairs and 80 for TV unit. Needs to be picked up before Friday in Prestonpans x.” 
It’s understood Jane was renting out the property for a while before putting it on the market in around September. 
She moved back into mother Linda’s home in Edinburgh’s Prestonfield area after complaining she felt lonely. 
Since her win, Jane, who was Britain’s youngest lottery millionaire, has splashed a fortune on designer handbags and holidays and £4,500 on breast enhancement surgery. Jane has decided to move back in with her mum (Photo: @janeparkx/Twitter) 
A spokesman for Jane said last night: “Jane has a strong team of financial advisers who help manage her portfolio of investments wisely. 
“From time to time, this will involve releasing funds from one profitable venture to enable her to reinvest into bigger projects.” 
Jane’s drink-driving case was thrown into chaos last month after Edinburgh Sheriff Court was told CCTV of the alleged incident had been “destroyed”. 
She faced a dash back to Scotland in time for her court appearance after missing a flight back from Tenerife because she was celebrating Hibs’ derby win over Hearts. 
She denies drink-driving at a McDonald’s drive-thru and will face trial this week. Like us on Facebook
